High-Frequency Water Quality Data from NEON

Source: R/data.R
neon_water_quality.Rd

A dataset containing 15-minute aggregated water quality measurements from three NEON sites: Arikaree River, Caribou Creek, and Lewis Run, spanning 2018-2019. This data is processed from the raw data provided by NEON, following the methods in Kermorvant et al. (2023).

Usage

neon_water_quality

Format

A data frame with 42315 rows and 10 variables:

siteID

NEON site code (ARIK, CARI, LEWI)

siteName

Full name of the NEON site

datetime

Timestamp for the 15-minute interval (POSIXct)

nitrate

Nitrate concentration (Âµmol/L)

temperature

Water temperature (Â°C)

dissolved_oxygen

Dissolved oxygen (mg/L)

specific_conductance

Specific conductance (ÂµS/cm)

turbidity

Turbidity (FNU)

log_turbidity

Log-transformed turbidity (log(turbidity + 1))

elevation

Surface water elevation (meters)

Source

https://doi.org/10.1371/journal.pone.0287640

https://data.neonscience.org
